action: Scroll 'Scroll down to see the complete sign-up form'
observation: I can see the Specter.AI homepage with multiple call-to-action buttons and form elements. There are 'Sign Up' and 'Create Account' buttons at the top, and I can see form fields for email and password further down the page. As an elderly user, I need to scroll down to see the complete sign-up form that appears to be below the current viewport.
reasoning: I need to scroll down to see the complete sign-up form. The form elements I can see (email input, password input, Next button) appear to be positioned much lower on the page (y-coordinates around 1700-2000), so I need to scroll down to access them properly. This is the logical next step after clicking the Create Account button.
ux_issues: Form elements are positioned very far down the page, requiring scrolling to access after clicking Create Account

evidence.actual_outcome: Scroll 'Scroll down to see the complete sign-up form'

issues: Form elements are positioned very far down the page, requiring scrolling to access after clicking Create Account

dual_diagnosis.visual_observation: The scroll action did not reveal any sign-up form. Both BEFORE and AFTER screenshots show the same minimal interface with only the Specter.AI logo, 'Sign Up' button in the top right, and some decorative elements (dashed rectangles and small colored squares) at the bottom. No form fields, inputs, or additional sign-up content became visible after scrolling.
dual_diagnosis.diagnosis: The scroll action failed to reveal the expected sign-up form content. This could be due to: 1) The form content not being loaded/rendered properly, 2) The scroll target area being incorrect, 3) The form being positioned outside the scrollable viewport, or 4) JavaScript not properly handling the scroll event to show form content.
